alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Piscataquis, southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Moosehorn Crossing, or 31 miles southeast of Clayton Lake, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Patten, Mount Chase, Oxbow, Shin Pond, Moosehorn Crossing, Dudley Township, northern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Baxter State Park, Stacyville, Merrill, Crystal, Dyer Brook, Hersey, Webbertown, Grand Lake Seboeis, Saint Croix, Grand Lake Matagamon and Moro Plantation. This includes State Highway 11 between Patten and Knowles Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook
